title: Dead Man's Plate Is Crowding Out Other Armor Items
body: Where is the line between this and "we made all the other armor items so bad this is the only Viable choice" to use?

replies.body: lol, what. are you out of your mind? this must be a prank

He is right.

When riot released Deadman, Sunfire and Randuins were already heavily nerfed, making Deadman the only good armor item that gives health.

It's not the only good armor item with health; it's the only one that can be used for general-purpose armor stacking. It's the only one that every champion would be happy to buy regardless of context. Not everybody wants damage reflection/ AoE burn/ Crit reduction, but everybody wants bonus MS with a damage buff.
It's the only good armor item unless you are someone like Malphite or Rammus.
And yet they wull still likely grab it. Move speed ins underrated yet so powerful.
it's good for tanks looking for some burliness and damage like rengar or even quinn
Don't forget the Thornmail and Frozen Heart nerfs

Meanwhile people forget how OP this item actually is {{item:3110}} sitting at 130% gold efficiency (higher than deadman plate) and providing almost twice as much armor while getting some mana and a ton of CDR... {{item:3110}} + {{item:1011}} > {{item:1031}} + {{item:3742}}
the reason why people don't get it is because its tank stats are worse. sure it gives more armor, but health is a better stat.
You're both right. I personally buy DMP as a 4th or 5th item on my tanks. I'm loving sunfire, iceborn and thornmail at the moment.

It just kept on getting chipped away at to the point of being generally unattractive. It lost armor and a bit of AS% slow as well. Hell, even {{item:3025}} is now a more feasible choice, 96.3% gold efficient WITHOUT passive. And that passive in a meta where CC matters a lot more is way more useful than an AS slow. Addition of Zeal items also hurt FH and Randuins, since stacking AS is a lot more common now. I mean, both items were also effective against BotRK which is now shit.

while I agree with most of what you said, I'm not  sure that i agree with your point about attack speed stacking hurting frozen heart. the way i see it, frozen heart effectively reduces the efficiency of every attack speed item by 25% not counting passives and such. that would mean that the more they stack attack speed the more they stack the efficiency loss.

Uh, Frozen Heart is 105% gold efficient by stats alone (and it's hard to say the exact value of the aura) and most imporantly - a lot of stats is used on non-combat stat (so to speak, unless you have mana scalings).

Also, FH + Giants Belt is 200 Gold more expensive and gives less defensive stats than DMP + Chain Vest:
FH+GB = 380 Health, 90 Armor
DMG+CV = 500 Health, 90 Armor

I would say that unless you are against a heavy autoattacker (Trynda, Trundle, Udyr, Yi) then Dead Man's Plate is just better.

honestly its very dependent on the team comps. if they have a fed adc or auto based champ, then frozen heart becomes better. otherwise, if you just need to be tanky then deadmans is much better since it has decent armor, and decent health. Plus anyone can benefit from movespeed/an extra slow. additionally, if you're a juggernaut, or at least a tank without a gap closer/mobility ability, you really prefer dead mans because of the bonus move speed which helps you get to where you're needed in a fight.

ok, some context here. 

they were specifically talking about dead mans, randuins and sunfire cape as the 3 big armor/health items for juggernauts, and how dead mans is "crowding out" the other two options as the only viable choice for these champions.

the problem with this is.

a) randuins. great item. also really fucking expensive, especially when you already have to get 3500 gold together for a cleaver. while randuins is a good item, its usually less comfortable to build and further delays your powerspike.

this is going to get changed, randuins price is going down.

b) sunfire cape. useless passive. since the aura nerf to level scaling its not a good duelling item anymore. thats it. 800 gold for additional waveclear on champions like garen, darius, illaoi who already have loads of wavclear. 

the passive is simply not worth the gold on those champions. making it a nieche item for ap scaling bruisers and tanks with poor or mana heavy waveclear like {{champion:54}} 

c) this only leaves dead mans, which adds universally good utility.

randuins is getting a bit cheaper which makes it a good contender to dead mans again. but sunfire remains crap until they sort out what the passive is supposed to accomplish for these champions.

the buff to minion damage makes me think they settled on it as a waveclear item. so that only leaves randuins and dead mans.


realistically even with these changes, dead mans will remain the item that is bought more often, since crit damage reduction and attack speed slows are very specific stats, that become necessary later on in the game more often than earlier on. its moe of a third or 4th items for the juggs to mitigate some lategame adc damage.

if games dont last that long, then randuins will still get bought less in general. i would rush it over dead mans in specific matchups like versing a yasuo or tryndamere. but those are going to be rare.

Well, if you're talking specifically about juggernauts, they have low mobility as a class weakness, so an item that helps them make up for that is obviously going to be extra useful.  That's about as surprising as saying poke mages get Luden's a lot, and IMO, not really any more problematic.

On the other hand if *everyone* who wants some health and armor prefers Dead Man's, even people like {{champion:54}} {{champion:254}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:24}}  who aren't dependent on walking up to people to engage, then that's a problem, the alternatives are genuinely not good enough alternatives.

Sunfire should be good enough to be a clearly stronger splitpush item than Dead Man's, and Randuin's should offer better teamfight utility if your kit gives you a way to get in, by slowing everyone instead of just one person.

Are you trying to say that Vi's engage isn't literally Walking Up, Pressing Q, then E (Proccing Deadman's) and E again?  She gets AMAZING use from DMP. Especially in the Jungle, where it gives her more mobility to get to where the fight's happening and Slamdunk it.

Also, DMP procs on Irelia Q, doesn't it?
Did we not literally have another post with the same exact title a few days ago?
We literally did. But it's free upvotes to complain about this subject so why not?
I agree that sunfire cape is in a rough spot, but Randuin's is still a great item to build in many situations.

It's not Dead Man's plate by itself. Between that, the new Black Cleaver, and Boots of Swiftness all of the supposedly "immobile" juggernauts have become fucking racecars. I actually used to buy it on Gangplank for a bit because between that, his passive, his W, and triforce, GP is insanely hard to pin down.
No no no, you buy DMP on Gangplank for lore reasons or not at all.
deadmans plate isnt crowding out other picks its just that the other items got nerfs the patch it came out of lol
They are going to make the passive on Sunfire cape deal *double* damage to minions/monsters. This should be a very interesting change. Clear the jungle like cheese and proxy waves hard?
isn't it 150% damage, not double?

>Clear the jungle like cheese

There's an item that will make this not happen, Cinderhulk's effect is unique from Sunfire's.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BQVQEqEe,comment-id=00030002,timestamp=2016-01-30T06:05:42.761+0000)
>
> There's an item that will make this not happen, Cinderhulk's effect is unique from Sunfire's.

Which leads to something very interesting... a case where you take Sunfire Cape as a Defensive Item, and take Warrior or Sated as your Jungle Item.  

This blend would be very interesting on a select few Champions.  Most take Cinderhulk to quickly complete the Jungle Item... but you can rush Bami and then complete the Jungle Item, finishing Sunfire next.  On Sated, this of course would put you behind a bit (already an issue) so better to apply with Warrior.

>This blend would be very interesting on a select few Champions. Most take Cinderhulk to quickly complete the Jungle Item... but you can rush Bami and then complete the Jungle Item, finishing Sunfire next. On Sated, this of course would put you behind a bit (already an issue) so better to apply with Warrior.

The only champs who I can think of who'd want both Sunfire and Warrior are Rek'sai and J4. It's an option for them though. Noct and Shyvana might also take Devourer into Sunfire.

I think a more interesting path is Runic Echoes into Sunfire. It might be good on champs like Amumu and Zac and probably will be good on Elise.

Overall I feel like Cinder's still going to be a better item in most cases for most of these champs though.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BQVQEqEe,comment-id=0003000200010000,timestamp=2016-01-31T08:18:05.459+0000)
>
> The only champs who I can think of who'd want both Sunfire and Warrior are Rek'sai and J4. It's an option for them though. Noct and Shyvana might also take Devourer into Sunfire.
> 
> I think a more interesting path is Runic Echoes into Sunfire. It might be good on champs like Amumu and Zac and probably will be good on Elise.
> 
> Overall I feel like Cinder's still going to be a better item in most cases for most of these champs though.

Which means we do have that option, at least on some.  Rek'sai and Jarvan, Nocturn and Shyvana... and you bring up Runic (I was leaving out AP, but AP Tanks do use Sunfire so good catch) so Amumu and Zac, with a possibility on Elise.

Which is what I love... the fact that there ARE choices, we may just have to look a bit deeper to figure them out.

They may not always be META, but then again things META now weren't META before... META changes.

So taking Cinder-Jungles and transferring instead to Sunfire for the benefits of Sated/Warrior/Echo may well be a better path, IF you are willing to take longer finishing the Jungle Item to rush the Bami you'll need, then make Sunfire your #2 (effectively slowing both being finished).

I often don't buy jungle items on jungle malphite (other than the starting item for mana regen).  It's better to get IBG and sunfire.  Cinderhulk isn't that strong since it got nerfed awhile back and Malphite scales so well with armor that I don't want early items without armor and I don't make much use of the %max health passive until later game.

usually not until later on in the game.

and as you pointed out, randuins right now is a lot more expensive than the other two. against most matchups the attack speed slow and crit reduction doesnt help you.

you dont need this over dead mans when fighting renekton.

Title of the thread: "Dead Man's Plate Is Crowding Out Other Armor Items"
The text of the post "Where is the line between this and "we made all the other armor items so bad this is the only Viable choice" to use?"
No where from that text are you able to imply that it was talking about juggernauts.
Randuin's Is more expensive yes, but a 4 second aoe slow is rather strong.
Um... sunfire cape at level 18 deals 43 damage per second.. If they have 100 mr(meaning they built mr) its down to 21.5 damage per second due to a 50% damage reduction. Which means that you need 105 hp per 5
Heimerdinger has the highest hp per 5 at 40.8.. In second place is 26.0 hp5 Sunfire is still dealing almost 4 times that natural regen and after the assumed 100 mr. Squishies still melt as you run into their face dealing closer to 170ish damage per 5.
They're all situational to build as I've said previously.

> [{quoted}](name=sickxapples,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BQVQEqEe,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-01-29T21:19:59.267+0000)
> No where from that text are you able to imply that it was talking about juggernauts.

the quote in the title was taken from the juggernaut itemization follow up discussion.

there are more factors involved with lategame sunfire. lifesteal, scaling mr runes, mr items for every class dimishes the damage dealt by the passive largely by lategame. ad bruisers and juggs dont bring magic pen into the game, so it really falls off for them as a damage item.

yes it, still deals a bit of damage. the question is, will you deal more damage when you invest the 800 gold youre paying for this passive into something else? like for example getting into range faster after your tank initiated a fight.


sunfire capes passive was never valued for lategame. it used to be a good duelling item for ad bruisers when you could rush it and gained 40 magic damage per second before you hit 6. since the damage nerf, its not good enough for duelling anymore, and those champions arent interested in getting it for waveclear.

To each their own I suppose :) I enjoy building it, so I guess I'll continue to do so. By the way.. 40 magic damage per second before 6? You realize that's broken on a stupid level right? lol Just so we're clear.

riot nerfed the aura damage to 30 flat once and that was already enough for it to fall out of favour, then they buffed it back to 40, then down to the level scaling.

You are just thinking too much. Buy fighters with some pure tanking items on your tanks and stomp everything.
Full tank champs are just some special case now.

When it's often picked up by carries as their one armor item of choice in addition to being a core item for tanks and bruisers and juggernauts, it's clear that it gives a number of things that are more desirable than other options.

A lot of the other armor items are ancient, and feel super outdated in comparison. I'm pretty sure {{item:3068}} was around for the Great Depression. 

{{champion:26}}

I personally get {{item:3110}}  almost every game and frequently use {{item:3068}}  but almost never use {{item:3742}} .  Deadman's plate is the best armor item if the champ getting it doesn't have a strong engage.  My mains are {{champion:111}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:44}} {{champion:12}} and {{champion:98}}  who all make great use of {{item:3110}} and {{item:3068}}  except for shen with fh.

The plan on the PBE is to increase Dead Man's Plate's cost by 100 and nerf the slow on the empowered autoattack to 50%, then buff Randuin's on stats and gold cost (50 health and -100 cost) and give Sunfire and Bami's Cinder increased damage to minions. That looks pretty fair to me.
